entity1.name: Language processing
entity1.description: A cognitive function that involves understanding and producing language.

entity2.name: human brain
entity2.description: The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing information and controlling bodily functions.

entity3.name: language processing
entity3.description: The cognitive and neurological processes involved in understanding, producing, and manipulating language.

entity4.name: brain
entity4.description: The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing sensory information and controlling bodily functions.

entity5.name: language processing
entity5.description: A series of steps or operations that transform input (such as speech or text) into output, typically for the purpose of understanding or generating language.

entity6.name: perception
entity6.description: The initial phase in language processing where the system recognizes and decodes input, whether it is speech sounds or written symbols.

entity7.name: auditory cortex
entity7.description: A region of the brain responsible for processing auditory information.

entity8.name: visual cortex
entity8.description: A region of the brain responsible for processing visual information.

entity9.name: brain
entity9.description: The brain is the central organ of the nervous system and plays a crucial role in processing information, including distinguishing between different phonemes and graphemes.

entity10.name: phonemes
entity10.description: Phonemes are the smallest units of sound that can distinguish meaning in a language.

entity11.name: graphemes
entity11.description: Graphemes are the smallest units of written symbols or letters in a writing system, which represent phonemes or sounds in a language.

entity12.name: Wernicke's area
entity12.description: A region in the brain involved in the comprehension of language.

entity13.name: left hemisphere of the brain
entity13.description: The left side of the brain, which is involved in language processing and other cognitive functions.

entity14.name: Broca's area
entity14.description: A region in the frontal lobe of the left hemisphere that plays a key role in speech production and language processing.

entity15.name: angular gyrus
entity15.description: A part of the parietal lobe, located at the junction of the temporal, parietal, and occipital lobes, involved in a variety of cognitive processes including language comprehension.

entity16.name: motor areas
entity16.description: Regions in the brain that are responsible for controlling voluntary movements.

entity17.name: frontal lobe
entity17.description: The largest lobe of the brain, located at the front of the head, involved in motor function, problem-solving, memory, language, judgment, and impulse control.

entity18.name: Broca's area
entity18.description: A region in the frontal lobe of the brain that is involved in speech production and language processing.

entity19.name: premotor cortex
entity19.description: A part of the motor cortex in the frontal lobe that plays a role in planning, control, and execution of voluntary movements.

entity20.name: brain
entity20.description: The brain is the central organ of the nervous system, responsible for controlling and coordinating most bodily activities.

entity21.name: mental lexicon
entity21.description: A mental lexicon refers to the vocabulary knowledge stored in an individual's mind, including words and their meanings.

entity22.name: grammatically correct sentences
entity22.description: Sentences that adhere to the grammatical rules of a language, making them understandable and coherent.

entity23.name: articulatory muscles
entity23.description: Muscles involved in the production of speech sounds, including those in the lips, tongue, and vocal cords.

entity24.name: brain regions
entity24.description: Areas within the brain that perform specific functions, in this case related to language processing.

entity25.name: language processing
entity25.description: The mental processes responsible for understanding and producing language.

entity26.name: Broca's area
entity26.description: A region in the frontal lobe of the brain that is involved in language production and grammatical processing.

entity27.name: left frontal lobe
entity27.description: The part of the cerebral cortex located in the left hemisphere of the brain, which includes areas responsible for motor functions and language production.

entity28.name: expressive aphasia
entity28.description: A condition where individuals have difficulty producing coherent speech, often resulting from damage to a specific area of the brain.

entity29.name: Wernicke's area
entity29.description: A region in the brain, located in the left temporal lobe, responsible for language comprehension and semantic processing.

entity30.name: left temporal lobe
entity30.description: A part of the cerebral cortex that is involved in auditory processing and is home to the Wernicke's area, which plays a key role in language comprehension.

entity31.name: receptive aphasia
entity31.description: A condition where individuals have difficulty understanding spoken or written language, often resulting from damage to a specific area of the brain.

entity32.name: angular gyrus
entity32.description: A part of the brain involved in integrating visual and auditory information to support reading and writing.

entity33.name: arcuate fasciculus
entity33.description: A bundle of nerve fibers connecting Broca's and Wernicke's areas, facilitating communication between them.

entity34.name: Broca's area
entity34.description: A region in the frontal lobe of the brain involved in speech production and language processing.

entity35.name: Wernicke's area
entity35.description: A region in the temporal lobe of the brain associated with language comprehension and understanding.

entity36.name: brain
entity36.description: The organ inside the skull that serves as the center of the nervous system and is responsible for thought, memory, sensory processing, and motor control.

entity37.name: language development
entity37.description: The process by which children acquire the ability to understand and produce language, typically progressing from babbling to complex sentences over several years.

entity38.name: communication disorders
entity38.description: A range of conditions that affect an individual's ability to communicate effectively, including speech and language impairments, hearing loss, and other related issues.

entity39.name: neurorehabilitation
entity39.description: A specialized form of rehabilitation aimed at helping individuals recover from or adapt to neurological conditions that affect movement, cognition, and communication.
